msgs.text: said: From my perspective, BTC will never scale well enough to be a global currency. Why do you believe it can? I'm genuinely very intrigued in this BTC future you imagine.
üåêScalability

So I don't think Bitcoin will have any problem scaling. Due to , millions of transactions per second are possible. The lightning network itself is growing exponentially in both nodes and bitcoin (I believe the liquidity now is over 3000 BTC).

In the future, large transactions (think millions and billions of dollars) will be done on the base layer. The elite and large institutions will use the base layer because it is technically more secure (I think). They wont mind waiting for their transactions to clear as long as they have faith that everything will be fine with their money.

Day-to-day "cup of coffee transactions" will take place on Lightning.
would love for you guys to weigh in here

Yeah I agree with Phil. I‚Äôm just starting to learn Bitcoin on a technical level so I can understand the programming of lighting. But as a concept and seeing how it‚Äôs scaling now is fascinating to me. I think it‚Äôs a really interesting second layer structure.
Yeah, if you've never used lightning I can send you some sats via Lightning so you can see how fast it is for yourself!
It‚Äôs secured by the base chain without needing to transact on it for instant settlement. Very cool

Yeah, so I'm not confident on my statement above regarding large transactions. Since the security of lighting is the same as the base layer. What is the benefit of doing a large transaction on the base layer? There is a reason why you want to do billion dollar transactions on the base layer...I'm just not remembering
The things that are built on top of Bitcoin are going to be so interesting. Lightning is just the start

Ah, now that I think of it it must be the benefit of final settlement. After 3 confirmations (three mined blocks, typically 30 minutes), it is mathematically guaranteed that your transaction is final and settled.
I guess theoretically one could stay on lightning one‚Äôs entire life. But at some point, you will value the security of final settlement on the blockchain.
It‚Äôll be a market. At some point you‚Äôll have to weigh how much you value that security. Because it will more than pennies at some point

Setting up nodes on lightning is arguablely more valuable for the lightning network than setting up nodes for Bitcoin at this point. How channels work and how sats are sent actually use the network.

That‚Äôs just my opinion, idk if I‚Äôm right. But I‚Äôve seen people talk about how Bitcoin nodes only serve yourself at this point for you to verify your own transactions. The network itself doesn‚Äôt care if you have a node or not. Technically only 1 Bitcoin node needs to exist and it can work.
I think the logic makes sense
I see where you're coming from. Well, the more nodes, the greater the decentralization and lower chance of network going offline. Although at this point I think we're fine haha
Yeah for sure. The argument is that now the Bitcoin network is over secure and sufficiently decentralized
So any more nodes coming online now don‚Äôt add as much to the network as adding nodes earlier in its life
But the sats on lightning are actually using the nodes and channels. So that‚Äôs pretty cool

A better way to say what I meant: you should always have a Bitcoin node (so I agree with you Phil). But you only technically need to turn the node on when you need to send transactions. Having the node on constantly doesn‚Äôt add value to the network in it of itself. Does that make sense?
Yeah that makes sense.
So in that sense, that‚Äôs what I meant when I said that the node is more valuable to the lightning network than the Bitcoin network.

Yeah, so a node's function is to verify the transactions put into the block by the miner. But what's the difference between 10,000 nodes verifying and 10,001? Meanwhile, a lightning nodes function is to create liquidity and faster transactions in the lightning network. More of those if definitely valuable. Is that in line with your thinking, ?
Yeah, well said. I like that framing

I don't think we can imagine what's going to come about. Lightning may be the micropayments solution for day-to-day spending, but I don't have the kind of confidence that many others do. I don't have nearly the same confidence in lightning as I do in bitcoin generally.
